--- title: "General Information" --- ## Date and location The school will be held from **15 to 19 September 2025** at the **Institute of Archaeology, Czech Academy of Sciences, Brno** ([https://arub.cz/](https://arub.cz/){.external}) at the address given below: > Čechyňská 363/19 > 602 00 Brno > Czech Republic ::: {.callout-tip} ## Note Please note that this is an on-site event only, and remote participation will **not** be possible. ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Grants Each participant of the school is eligible to receive a grant to cover travel expenses, housing, and daily subsistence during the meeting. To receive the grant, participants need to: 1. **Apply via the official form** of the ATRIUM Project (see the [Applications](applications.qmd) section for details). 2. **Participate in person**, i.e. sign attendance sheets for each training day. 3. **Submit a report** within a given time frame after the conclusion of the school with details of their participation. *Please note that the grant will be disbursed only upon the successful submission of this report*. ## Prerequisites - **Bring your own laptop!** - Bring a **camera** (or a phone with a good camera) you feel comfortable with. - When choosing from multiple lenses, wide-angle lenses are generally more suitable for the documentation of historic monuments. For artefact documentation, normal lenses (with a focal length around 50mm) are recommended. - **Install** [**RealityScan**](https://www.realityscan.com/en-US/download), a free 3D photogrammetry software. *Note: RealityScan **requires** a Windows computer with CUDA-enabled NVIDIA graphics card. If your system does not meet these requirements, you can download and install alternative software solutions. The most user-friendly alternative is [3DF Zephyr Free](https://www.3dflow.net/3df-zephyr-free/), which supports importing a maximum of 50 photos only. Another alternative (significantly slower and less user-friendly) is [MeshroomCL](https://github.com/openphotogrammetry/meshroomcl).* ## Other information ### Travelling to Brno Brno is easily reachable by trains or buses from Prague (approx. a 2 to 2.5-hour journey) and Vienna (approx. a 1.5 to 2-hour journey). Many overnight trains crossing a large part of Europe start or end in Vienna, and we recommend taking these trains as an alternative to flying. ### Accommodation No accommodation is provided to participants. Please arrange your accommodation in one of many cities hotels or hostels. ### Food There are several places around the institute, see map above for locations. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |place |cuisine |note | |:------------------------|:----------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------| |Little Saigon |Asian/Vietnamese |has vegan/vegetarian options | |Masný růžek |Czech |a lot of meaty foods and traditional heavy Czech cuisine | |Bistro Nella |Czech |might have vegetarian option | |Jídelna Kocourek |Czech |might have vegetarian option | |Grand Kitchen Vlněna |Czech, International |might have vegetarian option | |Bistro Bellavista |Italian |mostly does not have vegetarian/vegan options | |Delitree bistro |Italian, Czech, Salads |has vegetarian options | |Ramen Brno |Japanese |might have vegetarian options | |Los Capolitos |Mexican |hes vegetarian option | |Sargam |Nepalese |has vegetarian options | |Veg8Cafe |Vegan |vegan bistro | |Forky’s Vlněna Foodtruck |Vegan |vegan streetfood | ::: :::
